name: Uncomplicated Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
chief_complaint: It burns when I pee, and I feel like I have to go all the time.

lab_results.urinalysis: positive for leukocyte esterase and nitrites

prognosis: Excellent with prompt treatment; symptoms typically resolve within 48 hours of antibiotics
description: A bacterial infection of the lower urinary tract (bladder) without involvement of the kidneys or systemic symptoms. Most commonly caused by E. coli ascending from the urethra.
